FuncDef:
The peer log-change command enables a BGP device to log the session status and events of a specified group.
The undo peer log-change command cancels the configuration. The peer log-change command enables a BGP device to log the session status and events of a specified group. The undo peer log-change command cancels the configuration. By default, a BGP device is enabled to log the session status and events of a specified peer group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a BGP peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters and cannot contain spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: The peer log-change command can be used to enable a device to log the session status and events of a specified peer group, facilitating service management.
